results.title: Ed Thorgersen's sports review: playtime in Hawaii
results.creator_credit: Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation and Truman Talley
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine showing various outdoor recreation in Hawaii: net fishing from the rocky shores; mud sliding; arm wrestling; gymnastics; rugby; horseback riding along Honolulu’s shoreline; sailing; surfing; outrigger canoes.

results.title: Ecuador and the Galapagos Islands
results.creator_credit: Pilot Productions, Caroline Stuart and Peter Boyd MacLean
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Lonely planet: the experience”.
Justine Shapiro travels off the beaten track on a tour of Ecuador and the Galapagos Islands. She visits hot springs heated by a volcano, views the countryside from the roof of a train and almost tries roast guinea pig. A highlight of the journey is a visit to the Amazon forest, guided by the indigenous people of the area. The Galapagos Islands were made famous by Charles Darwin in developing his theory of evolution and are home to a fascinating diversity of wildlife, with many species found nowhere else in the world.

results.title: Ecstasy = Ekstase
results.brief_description: This controversial Czech film, featuring a very young Hedy Lamarr, gained international notoriety for its loose morals and a lengthy nude sequence. It was banned in America, Britain and Germany. The story follows a young woman’s search for love and fulfillment after she marries an unloving and much older man. Eventually she leaves him to return to the family home where she falls in love with a handsome young surveyor, but her husband discovers the affair and takes drastic action. The story is straightforward melodrama but an effortless sensuality and remarkable cinematography give the film a freshness and eloquence that is quite special.

results.title: Ecotourism: an experience with nature
results.creator_credit: Ben Cropp Productions, Seven Network Limited (Australia) and Ben Cropp
results.brief_description: What does the word “ecotourism” mean? By visiting some of Australia’s most exotic national parks, this program explains the concept. Resort owners and tour operators are attempting to provide quality experiences for tourists interested in nature without subjecting the local environment to the damage normally associated with tourism.

results.title: Ecotoons
results.creator_credit: WWF UK, Sally Richardson and Claire Breese
results.brief_description: Presented by Tony Robinson (Blackadder’s Baldrick), this World Wildlife Fund compilation of 30 international animated shorts is aimed at increasing awareness of environmental issues. Using claymation, stop start animation and computer animation, the tales cover a variety of issues such as pollution, overdevelopment, water and energy conservation, the dumping of toxic waste, recycling, logging, extinction and the depletion of the ozone layer. Also includes footage from the BBC series “Going live” in which a 12 year old viewer won a competition to have her storyboard for a “Morph” episode with a “green” theme brought to animated life by the Aardman studios. She visits Peter Lord at the studios who explains the animation process.

results.title: Ecosystems
results.creator_credit: ABC-TV (Australia), Victorian College of Agriculture and Horticulture and Robin Wischusen
results.brief_description:
Episode number 10 of Series “Growing awareness: Factors in plant production”.
Growers face conflicting interests - the need to grow plants economically and the need to ensure against long-term destructive environmental consequences. Four case studies feature four different ecosystems: 1. Managing a National Park - preserving the natural features while allowing public access 2. Agro-forestry - the combination of timber production and agriculture 3. Parwan Valley - where a local Landcare group is working to restore the environmental balance 4. An Urban Bushland environment.

results.title: Economies in transition (NP)
results.creator_credit: ABC-TV (Australia), Monash University, Open Learning Agency of Australia, Craig Saunders and Ashley Schwall-Kearney
results.brief_description:
Episode number 11 of Series “The Global Economy”.
This episode of the Open Learning Economics course examines the development of free market economic systems in the former communist states of Eastern Europe. The first episode looks at the emergence of liberal capitalism in Russia. The episode examines the benefits of opening Russia’s markets to the rest of the globe though it acknowledges that this embracement of capitalism, at an accelerated pace, has the potential to create devastating divisions based on wealth. The second episode looks at the success of capitalism in Poland which turned away from State Socialism in the early 1980s. In interviews with economists and Polish business people we are given an insight into some of the difficulties involved in dismantling a socialist economic system and replacing it with a market open to the international capitalist economy.

results.title: Economics for elementary: trade
results.creator_credit: Oxford Films, Art Evans Productions, Arthur G. Evans and Ray Nanley
results.brief_description:
Explains the role of the middle-man in trade using the retailing of tomatoes as an example. shows the growing of the crop and the labour employed; the selling of the crop to the wholesaler (distributor); the wholesaler’s overheads and how he distributes to retail outlets such as supermarkets and markets.
Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: Economics
results.creator_credit: Career Productions and Mutual Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Is this your career series”.
The economist is presented as a sort of management advisor to business or government. Outlines what is meant by “forces in the economy” through the activities of people. It then becomes possible to suggest the need for an understanding of these “forces” so that they may be kept operating satisfactorily. The role of the economist in business is shown.
